free_text.Learning outcomes: [b]Precision polymerization and macromolecular engineering[/b][br/][br/]This course consists of two parts. The first part will provide an overview of advanced methods for polymer synthesis. It will be shown how these techniques can be used to prepare polymers with precise control of molecular weight and molecular weight distribution, end-groups, stereo- and regioselectivity and topology. The second part will discuss several classes of complex macromolecular architectures and functional polymers and describe the use of these materials for advanced applications in e.g. optics, electronics and medicine.
